text.text: The PlayStation Portable (PSP) is a handheld game console developed by Sony and marketed between 2004 and 2014. It marks a turning point in the history of portable consoles by providing image quality and general capabilities approaching the PlayStation 2, a home console. The latest model released will be the PSP Go in October 2009, with its sliding screen, more memory and a Bluetooth connection. It has a 32-bit processor, two 3D graphics processors and itâ€™s able to read H.264 on its 16/9 screen. It was the first real competitor to Nintendo's handheld domination.
